com.avaya.csta.voiceunit

Interface ExtendedVoiceUnitServices

  • All Superinterfaces:
    VoiceUnitServices

    public interface ExtendedVoiceUnitServices
extends VoiceUnitServices
    Provides manipulation of a VoiceUnitServices recording session currently in progress. This interface is an Avaya extension to the CSTA Voice Unit Services.

    The extended services include the ability to dub over a specified portion of a recording. Dubbing allows the user to replace any duration of a recording session that is currently in progress with a given file. For example, if a conversation is being recorded and a password is about to be entered, then dubbing can be started with the startDubbing method such that the contents of another file replace the password. Dubbing can then be stopped with the stopDubbing method when the password entry is finished.

    Recordings that can be dubbed include those encoded with G.711 or PCM, but not G.729.

    The file used to dub over the recording must be a Wave file that has the following characteristics:

    • The file is in the standard Wave file format.
    • The file to dub with is compatible with the recording format. That is, the encoding formats of the dubbing file and the recording file must be the same. For example, if the recording is specified to be in G.711 A-law format, then the dubbing file must also be in G.711 A-law format.
    • The file is stored in the directory specified in the cmapi-user-configuration.properties file in the property called com.avaya.mvcs.media.VoiceUnitServices.dir.player.
    These extended services also include the ability to stop, suspend or resume either recording or playing independently, whereas the stop, suspend and resume methods in VoiceUnitServices apply to both recording and playing.
    Version:
    $Revision: 1.3 $
    Author:
    AVAYA, Inc.

    • Method Detail

      • startDubbing

        StartDubbingResponse startDubbing(StartDubbing request)
                           throws CstaException
        Starts replacing an existing recording session with the file specified in the request. See the StartDubbing request for more information. Use the stopDubbing method to stop the dubbing and return to the normal recording of the voice stream.
        Parameters:
        request - a request to begin dubbing. Request specifies the connection to be dubbed, what file is to replace the voice stream in the recording session, and the duration of the dubbing.
        Returns:
        A positive acknowledgement that the dubbing is being started. There is no useful information in the response.
        Throws:
        InvalidParameterValueException - if an invalid parameter is passed
        SystemResourceAvailabilityException - if there is a severe system error like unavailability of a system wide resource
        InvalidConnectionIDException - if unable to find the media session associated with the DeviceID of this request
        InvalidObjectStateException - if the recorder is in an invalid state
        InvalidFileException - if audio file format is not supported
        InvalidMsgIDException - if file (messageID) specified is not found
        OperationException - if an IOException occurs
        CstaException - if an implementation-specific exception occurs

      • stopDubbing

        StopDubbingResponse stopDubbing(StopDubbing request)
                         throws CstaException
        Stops replacement of an existing recording session. This method stops the dubbing that was started with the startDubbing method. See the StopDubbing request for more information.
        Parameters:
        request - a request to stop dubbing. Request specifies on what connection the dubbing is to stop.
        Returns:
        A positive acknowledgement that the dubbing is being stopped. There is no useful information in the response.
        Throws:
        InvalidParameterValueException - if an invalid parameter is passed
        SystemResourceAvailabilityException - if a severe system error occurs like unavailability of a system wide resource
        InvalidConnectionIDException - if unable to find the media session associated with the DeviceID of this request
        InvalidObjectStateException - if the recorder is in an invalid state
        OperationException - if an IOException occurs
        CstaException - if an implementation-specific exception occurs

      • suspendPlaying

        SuspendPlayingResponse suspendPlaying(SuspendPlaying request)
                               throws CstaException
        Temporarily stops the playing of the current message and leaves the position pointer at its current location. See the SuspendPlaying request for more information.

        To avoid potential timing problems, a VoiceUnitListener should be implemented and added prior to calling the suspendPlaying method. If a listener is added after the suspend method is called, the listener may or may not receive the appropriate event (the event may occur before the listener is added).

        The VoiceUnitListener event that may be caused by a SuspendPlaying request is:

        • SuspendPlayEvent

        The Voice Unit shall continue to play the message starting at the current position pointer upon receiving the resume or resumePlaying service request.

Parameters:
request - a request to temporarily stop the playing of the current message. Request parameters identify the connection (device).
Returns:
a SuspendPlayingResponse indicates that VoiceUnitServices has accepted the request, the request appears valid, and the request is being processed. There is no useful information in the response.
Throws:
InvalidParameterValueException - if an invalid parameter is passed
InvalidConnectionIDException - if unable to find the Media Session associated with the DeviceID of this request
OperationException - if an IOException occurred or if a channel is already closed
SystemResourceAvailabilityException - if a severe system error l ike un-availability of a system wide resource
InvalidObjectStateException - if the player or recorder is in an invalid state
CstaException - if an implementation-specific exception occurs
Since:
2.1
See Also:
VoiceUnitServices.suspend(ch.ecma.csta.binding.Suspend)

  • suspendRecording

    SuspendRecordingResponse suspendRecording(SuspendRecording request)
                                   throws CstaException
    Temporarily stops the recording of the current message and leaves the position pointer at its current location. See the SuspendRecording request for more information.

    To avoid potential timing problems, a VoiceUnitListener should be implemented and added prior to calling the suspendRecording method. If a listener is added after the suspend method is called, the listener may or may not receive the appropriate event (the event may occur before the listener is added).

    The VoiceUnitListener event that may be caused by a SuspendRecording request is:

    • SuspendRecordEvent

    The Voice Unit shall continue to record the message starting at the current position pointer upon receiving the resume or resumeRecording service request.

    Parameters:
    request - a request to temporarily stop the recording of the current message. Request parameters identify the connection (device).
    Returns:
    a SuspendRecordingResponse indicates that VoiceUnitServices has accepted the request, the request appears valid, and the request is being processed. There is no useful information in the response.
    Throws:
    InvalidParameterValueException - if an invalid parameter is passed
    InvalidConnectionIDException - if unable to find the Media Session associated with the DeviceID of this request
    OperationException - if an IOExcpetion occurred or if a channel is already closed
    SystemResourceAvailabilityException - if a severe system error like un-availability of a system wide resource
    InvalidObjectStateException - if the player or recorder is in an invalid state
    CstaException - if an implementation-specific exception occurs
    Since:
    2.1
    See Also:
    VoiceUnitServices.suspend(ch.ecma.csta.binding.Suspend)

  • resumePlaying

    ResumePlayingResponse resumePlaying(ResumePlaying request)
                             throws CstaException
    Restarts the playing of a previously suspended message at its current position. See the ResumePlaying request for more information.

    Parameters:
    request - a request to restart the playing of a previously suspended message at its current position. Request parameters specify the connection and the message to be resumed.
    Returns:
    a ResumePlayingResponse indicating that VoiceUnitServices has accepted the request, the request appears valid, and the request is being processed.
    Throws:
    InvalidParameterValueException - if an invalid parameter is passed
    InvalidConnectionIDException - if unable to find the Media Session associated with the DeviceID of this request
    OperationException - if an IOExcpetion occurred or if a channel is already closed
    SystemResourceAvailabilityException - if a severe system error like un-availability of a system wide resource
    InvalidObjectStateException - if the player or recorder is in an invalid state
    CstaException - if an implementation-specific exception occurs
    Since:
    2.1
    See Also:
    VoiceUnitServices.resume(ch.ecma.csta.binding.Resume)
